RECREATIONAL.summary: It is not legal for adults to possess cannabis for recreational use in North Dakota. State law classifies marijuana as a Schedule I controlled substance, and possession by adults outside the medical marijuana program is a criminal offense. The most recent attempt to legalize adult-use cannabis, Measure 5 (2024), was rejected by voters, and no subsequent legislative changes have altered the prohibition.
RECREATIONAL.gov_quote: "Any person who willfully violates this subsection with respect to: a. Possession of less than one-half ounce [14.175 grams] of marijuana is guilty of a criminal infraction punishable by a fine of up to one thousand dollars."

MEDICAL.summary: It is legal for registered medical marijuana patients in North Dakota to possess cannabis, provided they hold a valid North Dakota Medical Marijuana Registry Identification Card, have a qualifying medical condition, and comply with strict possession limits and product requirements. Patients must purchase cannabis exclusively from state-licensed dispensaries, may not cultivate at home, and must adhere to limits such as up to 3 ounces of dried flower (with higher limits for certain conditions) and specified THC limits for concentrates and edibles.
MEDICAL.gov_quote: "A registered qualifying patient or registered designated caregiver is not subject to arrest or prosecution, penalty, or denial of any right or privilege for the purchase, use, or possession of usable marijuana for medical purposes, provided the patient or caregiver is in compliance with this chapter."
MEDICAL.validation_notes: All information verified as accurate. The government quote was found verbatim on the official North Dakota Department of Health and Human Services medical marijuana page. MEDICAL_STORE.summary: It is legal for registered medical marijuana patients in North Dakota to purchase cannabis from state-licensed dispensaries. Patients must hold a valid North Dakota medical marijuana card and may only buy cannabis from one of the eight registered dispensaries in the state.
MEDICAL_STORE.gov_quote: An individual with a North Dakota medical marijuana card is only authorized to purchase and possess medical marijuana from one of the eight registered dispensaries in the state. State law has no protections for individuals in North Dakota with marijuana or marijuana products not purchased from an in-state registered dispensary.
